abstract: Research commissioned by opponents of nuclear power indicates that electricity in New York State would remain reliable and reasonably priced if Indian Point nuclear reactors were permanently shut down; findings directly contradict those of experts hired by Bloomberg administration.
snippet: One report sees enough power for nearly a decade if the Westchester County reactors are closed down, but another warns of a risk of blackouts in five years.
lead_paragraph: One report sees enough power for nearly a decade if the Westchester County reactors are closed down, but another warns of a risk of blackouts in five years.
